description: From a series of five lithographs for Der Lebende Leichnam (The Living Corpse) by Leo Tolstoy, published by Karl Lang Verlag in Darmstadt, 1919; male figure tilted forward and dressed in black in lower left with hands in fists out in front of him; female figure tilted backwards and dressed in black behind him with long arms and open palms stretched in front of her and toward male figure
inscription: LRC in plate: P.W.G. /19. | LL in pencil, below image: 1) | LL of sheet, in pencil: Privat-exemplar. | LLC of sheet, in pencil: E.68 | LL margin of sheet, in pencil: E68-72, volevändig-A | LR of sheet, in pencil: 5 Lithos zu Tolstoy : / \"der lebende Leichnam\" | LLC and LRC of sheet in pencil, on verso: 785
portfolio: From Plate 1 from Der Lebende Leichnam (The Living Corpse), Leo Tolstoy, published by Karl Lang Verlag in Darmstadt, 1919
signed: LR in pencil, below image: Walter Gramatté / 19
title: Fedja und Sascha, Plate 1 from Der Lebende Leichnam (The Living Corpse)
